key_dates.description: Third turning point. Particularly strong date.
Fifth turning point. Aligns with weekly cycle.

seasonal: August generally positive (bullish) for Oil. One strong monthly cycle. Two weekly cycles ending Aug 22/29. Last window expected for significant trend change.

statistics.description: Oil closed higher on Aug 12 vs Aug 7 in ~70% of 30 years.

insights: Bullish seasonal month with one monthly cycle and two weekly cycles.
Aug 14 considered strong. Dates 19-22/28 align with weekly cycles.
Price in $64.10-$64.85 range confirming bullish pattern. 61.8% Fib support holding.
Trapped between $55.30 support and $66.50 resistance since September.
Above $80 = significant trend change. Below $55.30 = deeper bearish signal.
Two decade patterns (10/20-year) point to highs in August. Aug 31 significant.
If price rises to Aug 28-31 area, possible peak and reversal.
Weekly cycles ending Aug 22/29 could create sharp moves.
Support at $60.445 (trend continuation). Immediate Fib support $64.85.
Key resistance at $69.655 above current ceiling.

support.description: Major historical support. Held since April.

technical.indicators: Above $55.30 historical support. Trapped $55-66 range. Two decade patterns point to August highs. Weekly cycles ending Aug 22/29. Daily in upward channel with Fib support at $64.

summary: Oil August 2025: bullish seasonal bias with five turning points (Aug 1, 7, 14, 20-21, 28). Trapped between $55-56 and $64-66. Decade patterns suggest highs around Aug 28-31 then possible reversal. Above $80 = trend change.
previous_month_review: July: 4 dates. 01.07=low on support, +6%. 09.07=high, -3% decline then recovery. 14-15.07=double cycle at resistance, no skip, reversed up. 30-31.07=double cycle at resistance, decline on second date. Unclear at writing.
risk_notes: NO open positions over weekends - Oil highest surprise risk.
Decade patterns suggest peak Aug 28-31 then reversal.
Weekly cycles Aug 22/29 could create sharp moves.
Below $55.30 = next support much lower at $51-52.70.
Aug 14 particularly strong - significant volatility expected.
